title: Abused and Told to Kill my self Multiple Times
body:
Account: <MOD EDIT>
This player told me to kill my self over private messaging 
First occurrence 

"
Him: 
its very apparent
if ur this messed up in the head
ur life is so patheic
u might as well kill yourself
bc noone will miss u"

"
Him:
hang urself
only possible way for ur parents to have happiness at this point
u have disappointed them too much

ME:
i dont know how to hang my self, how do i do it?

Him:
damn theres some youtubes vid u can look up

ME:
i dont know how to find them."

Screenshots can be provided if needed.

replies.body:
Report this to player support.

But, this is in a private message. You should remove the person / block them on your friends list. This is an opt-in communication which you can end at any time.

I'm sorry for grave digging this thread, but I've seen that Rioters are not very active in player behaviour topics, so I would like to catch the possibility to maybe talk with one of them.

Why is there a "but"? It a little bit implies to me, that if the player "can end at any time" then it is not such a big deal, is it really the case or did I misunderstand something?

(If I never get a reply to this, or even gets removed for grave digging, no problem, but I hope the rioters would pay a little bit more attention to "player behaviour" topics, since here is what the problems with the game are, yet I don't see too much activity by their side!)

Totally agree with that, I reported a player telling me and others to kill ourselves, both in game and through riot support and stalked his profile. He kept playing and playing and all I got from riot support was cookie cutter responses over and over. The "but" is indeed really weird as the same thing can apply in game "just mute them".
Problem is that the system can't watch over direct messages because of some data security reasons. I guess.
My question was not aimed this way, but thanks.

The rest of your post is fine, but I would recommend submitting a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with the date, time, and player name/region they're on.
